page.title: 06LANDSCAPE
page.content:
{Burhill Estates Ltd.}
Burhill Estates is a land development company which owns a large amount of land around Pyrford. When Lord Iveagh of the Guiness family died in 1968, the land was sold to Burhill estates but the Guiness family still have shares in the company. Most of the land is farmland but some has been developed as can be seen in the case of{Hoebridge Golf Centre}(1980). Other land is leased to two farms:{Lady {Place Farm}-used for livestock and{ {Roundbridge Farm}-an arable share farm growing barely wheat and oats. Estate accomodation is inhabited by employees of Burhill Estates. There are no immediate plans for future development of this grade 3 farm land.
